instruction: what is the Billing Governance Transformation for Outsourced Workforce project about?
input:
Context from Vector Database:
Source 1 (prabhu_resume.pdf):
Duration: Jun 2018 – Dec 2020 

Project Title: Billing Governance Transformation for Outsourced Workforce 
 
 
 
 

Identified and addressed a critical compliance gap by implementing verification controls for outsourced employee billing. 
Deployed a centralized monitoring mechanism using in-out swipe registers, linking employee movements to approved route timings. 
Introduced the Route Productivity Report (RPR), mandating daily location-wise route tracking and monthly vendor billing analysis. 


Context from Knowledge Graph:
[No relevant entities found]
output: The Billing Governance Transformation for Outsourced Workforce project was conducted from June 2018 to December 2020. This project identified and addressed a critical compliance gap by implementing verification controls for outsourced employee billing. It deployed a centralized monitoring mechanism using in-out swipe registers, linking employee movements to approved route timings. The project introduced the Route Productivity Report (RPR), mandating daily location-wise route tracking and monthly vendor billing analysis. This initiative significantly improved compliance and operational efficiency in workforce management.

instruction: what is the Regulatory Compliance Excellence & Operational Reporting project about?
input:
Context from Vector Database:
Source 1 (prabhu_resume.pdf):
Achieved a 50%+ reduction in average field staff overtime, bringing it down from 210 hours per employee in July 2018 to 106 hours by June 2019, 
significantly optimizing labor productivity and cost. 

Duration: Jun 2018 – Dec 2020 

Project Title: Regulatory Compliance Excellence & Operational Reporting 
 

Acted  as the  single  point  of  contact  for  compliance  with RBI  and  Ministry  of  Home Affairs (MHA)  guidelines  across  vehicles, vaults,  employee 
training, and operational standards. 


Context from Knowledge Graph:
[No relevant entities found]
output: The Regulatory Compliance Excellence & Operational Reporting project was conducted from June 2018 to December 2020. This project achieved a 50%+ reduction in average field staff overtime, bringing it down from 210 hours per employee in July 2018 to 106 hours by June 2019, significantly optimizing labor productivity and cost. The project acted as the single point of contact for compliance with RBI and Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) guidelines across vehicles, vaults, employee training, and operational standards. This initiative ensured full organizational compliance and enhanced regulatory transparency.

instruction: what is the Mobile Application for Custodian Operations project about?
input:
Context from Vector Database:
Source 1 (prabhu_resume.pdf):
Project Title: Mobile Application for Custodian Operations 
 
 
 
 
 
 

Designed & deployed a mobile application empowering custodians to log entries directly from remote locations, increasing field efficiency. 
Led full-cycle UI/UX and functionality design in close coordination with stakeholders to ensure intuitive user experience and robust functionality. 
Engineered a QR code system—both static and dynamic—for real-time cash pickup authentication, enabling seamless operations. 


Context from Knowledge Graph:
[No relevant entities found]
output: The Mobile Application for Custodian Operations project involved designing and deploying a mobile application that empowers custodians to log entries directly from remote locations, significantly increasing field efficiency. The project included full-cycle UI/UX and functionality design in close coordination with stakeholders to ensure intuitive user experience and robust functionality. A key feature was engineering a QR code system—both static and dynamic—for real-time cash pickup authentication, enabling seamless operations. This mobile solution streamlined custodian operations and improved operational efficiency through digital transformation.

instruction: when did prabhu raj p work on the Billing Governance Transformation project?
input:
Context from Vector Database:
Source 1 (prabhu_resume.pdf):
Duration: Jun 2018 – Dec 2020 

Project Title: Billing Governance Transformation for Outsourced Workforce 

Identified and addressed a critical compliance gap by implementing verification controls for outsourced employee billing. 
Deployed a centralized monitoring mechanism using in-out swipe registers, linking employee movements to approved route timings. 
Introduced the Route Productivity Report (RPR), mandating daily location-wise route tracking and monthly vendor billing analysis. 


Context from Knowledge Graph:
[No relevant entities found]
output: Based on the resume, PRABHU RAJ P worked on the Billing Governance Transformation for Outsourced Workforce project from June 2018 to December 2020. During this period, he identified and addressed a critical compliance gap by implementing verification controls for outsourced employee billing. He deployed a centralized monitoring mechanism using in-out swipe registers, linking employee movements to approved route timings. The project introduced the Route Productivity Report (RPR), mandating daily location-wise route tracking and monthly vendor billing analysis. This project spanned approximately 2.5 years and significantly improved compliance and operational efficiency.

input:
Context from Vector Database:
Source 1 (prabhu_resume.pdf):
Achieved a 50%+ reduction in average field staff overtime, bringing it down from 210 hours per employee in July 2018 to 106 hours by June 2019, 
significantly optimizing labor productivity and cost. 

Duration: Jun 2018 – Dec 2020 

Project Title: Regulatory Compliance Excellence & Operational Reporting 

Acted  as the  single  point  of  contact  for  compliance  with RBI  and  Ministry  of  Home Affairs (MHA)  guidelines  across  vehicles, vaults,  employee 
training, and operational standards. 


Context from Knowledge Graph:
[No relevant entities found]
output: Based on the resume, PRABHU RAJ P worked on the Regulatory Compliance Excellence & Operational Reporting project from June 2018 to December 2020. During this period, he achieved a 50%+ reduction in average field staff overtime, bringing it down from 210 hours per employee in July 2018 to 106 hours by June 2019. He acted as the single point of contact for compliance with RBI and Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) guidelines across vehicles, vaults, employee training, and operational standards. This project spanned approximately 2.5 years and significantly optimized labor productivity and cost while ensuring full organizational compliance.
